web.controller.communication.http

Class HTTPCommunication

  • java.lang.Object
    • web.controller.communication.http.HTTPCommunication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WebCommunication

    public class HTTPCommunication
extends Object
implements WebCommunication
    This class defines the HTTP Endpoint. As implementation of the websocket interface it is responsible for converting CRUD request from HTTP specific format to CRUD calls for representation manager. Also te reconversion of internal statuscodes and answer file to HTTP specific Responses is done here.
    Author:
    Jan-Peter.Schmidt

      • recognizeCreate

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response recognizeCreate(String name,
                                                 InputStream uploadedInputStream,
                                                 org.glassfish.jersey.media.multipart.FormDataContentDisposition fileDetail,
                                                 @Context
                                                 javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders httpHeaders)
        Recognizes a create request, by listening to incoming POST-calls. Incoming stuff is prepared and delegated to executeCreate(String name, File file)
        Parameters:
        name - Name of new representation
        uploadedInputStream - InputStream of uploaded file
        fileDetail - Details of uploaded file
        httpHeaders - HttpHeaders sent by this request
        Returns:
        Response for user with statuscode and some other specific header information.

      • recognizeRead

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response recognizeRead(@Context
                                               javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers,
                                               String name)
        Recognizes a read request by listening to incoming GET-calls. Incoming stuff is prepared and delegated to executeRead(String name, String accept).
        Parameters:
        headers - Headers sent by request.
        name - Name of vritual representation that should be read.
        Returns:
        Returns Response with Datafile (HTML or RDF) and specific header options.
